innovationCenter.name: 1Haler: Revolutionizing Asthma Care
innovationCenter.description: 1Haler is an engineering senior design project focusing in asthma care for rescue situations. Visitors will learn about the prevalence of asthma, how it can be treated, and our innovative design. This exhibit will allow visitors a hands on experience with demos of the 1Haler and other inhalers currently used by asthma patients. The 1Haler is cheaper, easier to use, and more convenient to use than its competitors on the market; this exhibit showcases its novelty.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Taylor Agnello, Chantel Charlebois, Melissa Mendoza, Stephen Choi, Laura Alderfer

innovationCenter.name: A Small Robot Story
innovationCenter.description: A Small Robot Story is a short adventure-platform where you play as Rae, a small robot who activates and has no programming, so you need to set out and find out what's up! With a heavy emphasis on story, A Small Robot Story will take you through forests, factories, caves, laboratories, and more as you track down the source of your sudden activation.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, Rob Mostyn

innovationCenter.name: AWARE: Driver Fatigue Solutions
innovationCenter.description: Our student entrepreneur team brings you AWARE: Driver Fatigue Solutions. We are displaying a device that can monitor signs of fatigue and alert users when they are becoming dangerously drowsy. Come try it out for yourself! Meet our team, hear our story, and witness how our idea has developed. We recently raised over $2,000 through successful crowd-funding to further develop our device, so come and see what the buzz is about!
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Ethan Kersat, Emmanuel Dodoo, Zach Moxley

innovationCenter.name: B.U.S. - Be Heard, Unite Voices, Stand Together
innovationCenter.description: B.U.S. is an app designed to connect students who have been bullied as well as concerned parents/teachers. The best way to overcome an instance of bullying is by understanding and knowing that you are not the only person that this has happened to. People can post their stories and read the stories of others so that they can find someone who is, or has, gone through the same thing. 'Be heard, Unite voices, Stand together!'
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Sophia Dower

innovationCenter.name: DADCo: Consumer Focused Electromyography
innovationCenter.description: DADCo wants to bring Electromyography (a biodiagnostic technique) into the consumer marketplace. We will be creating smartwatches and smart wrist-bands that interface with different electrical devices, including but not limited to smartphones, computers, and robotic prosthetics. At Imagine we are showing off a Bionic Hand concept that we have built for an amputee on campus.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Joseph DiPassio, Colin Fausnaught, John Grosh, and Dan Berg

innovationCenter.name: Farewell to Dawn (Personal Viewing Experience)
innovationCenter.description: Farewell to Dawn is a mixed reality dance performance that explores two dancers' voyage from a physical motion capture space to a virtual stage, as the day passes before them. The piece will be presented through the Oculus Rift, a Virtual Reality headset and will allow users the choice to view the performance from the audience of the virtual auditorium or from a seat on the virtual stage.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, Joe Geigel, Jacqueline Devine, Eric Knapik, Antara Anilesh Kumar Mishra

innovationCenter.name: Gibraltar: A Lunch-time Strategy Game
innovationCenter.description: In Gibraltar, two players move their pieces around the board in attempt to control territory. The more territory you control, the more moves you can make per turn. This unique take on strategy games and board games allows players more freedom in crafting their own strategies and experiences.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, John Miller

innovationCenter.name: HiBeams - Intelligent Lighting for Longboards
innovationCenter.description: HiBeams is a technology company, started by RIT students Leondro McHenry and James Kemper, developing intelligent motion-based lighting systems for various applications. We will be exhibiting our new prototype, the first intelligent safety lighting system designed specifically for longboards and skateboards. We will be presenting visitors with the technology we've developed through interactive demonstrations.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Leondro McHenry, James Kemper

innovationCenter.name: Kore-X Chiropractic Pressure Mapping Mat
innovationCenter.description: The Kore-X Strength and Stability System is a flexible, portable, wireless smart mat designed for patients with chronic back pain. The mat will help teach patients how to do simple back exercises properly to strengthen and isolate the core back muscles and also provides the capability to track their progress. The product will have an interface that can be downloaded as an app on a mobile device, tablet or laptop.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Evan Vershay

innovationCenter.name: LiftForce: Next Gen. Fitness Technology
innovationCenter.description: LiftForce is a fitness technology company that uses computer vision software to analyze a person's lifting form and provide feedback in real-time. This software is installed in gyms and available for member use. Our mobile app can store and track lifting data, as well as receive biomechanics feedback in the app for improving mobility and thus form.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Evan Oslakovich, Ian Young, Anthony Vullo, Stephen Moskal , Dakota Baber, Nicholas Mattis

innovationCenter.name: Lily Pad - Sensory Play
innovationCenter.description: Lily Pad is an interactive system of smart mats that emit lights, sounds and vibration patterns to guide children with special needs in daily activities. Our exhibit at Imagine RIT will be interactive and will be demonstrating the functionality of the product. Visitors will be able to interact with the pads and and immerse in a sensorial experience with lights and animated projections. Come visit the Lily Pad exhibit and be part of this adventure with us!
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Mariana Leitao Pinheiro

innovationCenter.name: Motorized Pediatric Stander
innovationCenter.description: Pediatric standers are medical devices that allow children who are unable to stand the opportunity to do so. A limitation of many standers is that they are stationary. We are continuing the work of previous RIT teams to develop a universal motorization kit to modify existing pediatric standers. The kit enables children to explore their environment autonomously for the first time. Our new design can be attached to any existing pediatric stander and includes numerous user-centered improvements.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Elizabeth Stegner, Thomas Guerin, Andrew Kowalczyk, Spar Patton, Khalifa Albishr, Sean Garbarino, Ahmed Alzaabi

innovationCenter.name: Otto - Therapy Play
innovationCenter.description: Otto is an interactive device designed for children with special needs. The toy emits lights, sounds and vibration patterns in response to movements such as taping and shaking. In our exhibit at Imagine RIT we will be demonstrating the product and inviting the visitors to play and interact with different versions of Otto.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Mariana Leitao Pinheiro

innovationCenter.name: OWA Haircare - The First Dehydrated Shampoo
innovationCenter.description: OWA Haircare is an innovative hair care company that is revolutionizing the industry by offering plant-based, environmentally friendly products to humans who support a sustainable life on planet Earth. Get a sneak peak of OWA's first product - a waterless shampoo!
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Kailey Bradt

innovationCenter.name: PuckPasser
innovationCenter.description: P.A.P.P.I, The Portable Automated puck passing implement,is an automated puck passing and shooting device, designed to quickly, safely and easily provide the user with game equivalent passes and shots that are both accurate and an appropriate velocity for the user's level. P.A.P.P.I can be used to assist the user with both team and individual drills and it also has adjustable speed, rotation, tilting and shot intervals. The unit is easy to transport on and off the ice and it features a goalie mode that focuses on the weak spots of a goalie to assist coaches and players with goalie training.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Diane Cantisano, Doug Yencer, Ryan Parsons, Chad Uckermark , Spencer Argenna, Matthew Webster

innovationCenter.name: RIT's Venture Creations Business Incubator
innovationCenter.description: Come join RIT's Venture Creations Business Incubator as we showcase some of our start-up company clients including: ThermApparel; Positive Science; Empire Medicinals; Hand Scan; and Dimension Technologies. You'll have a chance to learn about these companies and their exciting projects, meet the entrepreneurs behind the companies, and learn about how RIT is supporting the development and growth of start-ups throughout our region.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Cindy Papaleo, Rich Notargiacomo, Jeff Arywitz, Tom Curtin, Kurtis Kracke, Chris Carter, George Zheng, Brad Sparks, Jason Babcock, Luke Luft

innovationCenter.name: Rock Stars
innovationCenter.description: The Rock Stars rock climbing project was given to us in the IDEA Lab last semester. We were to develop a product that would help children with autism or attention disorders to rock climb. Proposed solutions were to use lights, sounds, and texture on, inside, or around a rock climbing peg.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Evan Misiorski

innovationCenter.name: Scrubbing Bubbles
innovationCenter.description: We have designed a Roomba vacuum that will be converted it into a model of the 'Scrubbing Bubbles' character. It will still acts as a vacuum and blows bubbles as it moves around Student Innovation Hall.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Jenn Hinton, Dan Schneiderman, Nathaniel Larrimore

innovationCenter.name: Transfer Lift for Adaptive Ski Programs
innovationCenter.description: Our team is working to improve accessibility for skiers with impaired leg movement. We've partnered with Swain Mountain's Shared Ski Adventures program to build a lift that will help them transfer skiers from a wheelchair to a sit ski and back, which reduces strain on volunteers who currently have to lift skiers manually.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Ana Sorensen, David Villareal, Christopher Shyne, Tom Janosky, Samkit Lunawat

innovationCenter.name: Virtual Reality Arm
innovationCenter.description: Imagine an anatomy or drawing instructor speaking to students and being able to touch the skin on a virtual model to make it disappear and expose the anatomy underneath. If we can develop a system to draw from a virtual figure we can expand student understanding of the human body as well as expand the definition of the drawing studio and change how we teach life draw.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Craig Foster, Allison Buck, Danielle Sternberg, Shannon Gregory, Katelyn Fiebke, Alexander Cook, Jesse O'Brien, Tim Yuan, Joey Tong, Jenn Hinton

innovationCenter.name: Wheelness: Wheelchair Wellness
innovationCenter.description: A wearable device for wheelchair users that tracks activity and aids therapy. Concept and Prototype.
innovationCenter.exhibitors: Deepti Chintalapudi, Gagan Ahuja, Grace Yukawa
